A history of gestational hypertension exposes the patient to a ''risk of chronic hypertension'' as well as an increased risk of cardiovascular and renal pathologies, hence the importance of appropriate subsequent monitoring++++

question.title: What is a potential long-term complication of gestational hypertension?
question.description: A patient with a history of gestational hypertension is at risk for

option_a.title: Preeclampsia
option_a.description: A condition characterized by high blood pressure and damage to organs such as the kidneys and liver

option_b.title: Chronic kidney disease
option_b.description: A condition in which the kidneys gradually lose their ability to function

option_c.title: Cardiovascular disease
option_c.description: A broad term that encompasses various conditions affecting the heart and blood vessels

option_d.title: Postpartum depression
option_d.description: A condition characterized by feelings of sadness and hopelessness after childbirth

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: The first letter of the correct option
